website_summaries.verdict: With a comfortable price point for anyone interested in trying a fountain pen made with solid craftsmanship, this writing implement is a perfect starter tool.
pros: Nib size can be changed easily
Ink flows smoothly without sputtering, and the pen works well for both writing and drawing
First-time fountain pen buyers are happy with how quickly they're able to learn to use it, and that it feels natural in the hand
cons: Newbies might need trial and error to determine what nib size works best
some find that medium writes too thickly

customer_reviews.title: A fine choice in pen
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried this pen I must admit I wasn't at all impressed, maybe even disappointed. It hardly seemed any better than the regular ballpoint pens I get for a couple bucks at the gas station. But last night, I felt particularly called upon to write so I picked up this fountain pen and began writing. I'm not sure what happened, but something clicked. I finally got it - the feeling. The feeling of unrestricted fluidity between me and the paper. It was as if there was no pen - just me and the paper. It was magical. I love this pen now and this turned out to be one of the best purchases I made this year.
customer_reviews.author: Contrell

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: The pen stopped working, even with new ink cartridges. I contacted support and got radio silence.
customer_reviews.author: Greg N. Spero

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Received in padded envelope. Product in black plastic heavily taped made me suspect it was a return. Box is crushed. No documentation or instructions for replacing cartridge. Had intended as a gift but not able to give it with such poor presentation. Realize it is inexpensive but do not recommend even for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: ji

customer_reviews.title: Felt very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this pen seems very cheap and fragile. There's nothing to write home about this product. I've had better experiences with $3 pens than this one, and unless you're into calligraphy, I just don't see the value for the price. I'm not sure if the reviews were paid for, but they aren't truthful. Someone actually quoted this pen was a "showstopper". It's very plain and the material the pen is made out of is cheap, and lightweight. If you're going to spend that much money on a pen, don't do it on this one. I'm embarrassed that I gave this to my brother on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain pen!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of a fountain pen and I don't know if I'll ever go back. The Lamy Safari has stellar reviews on Amazon sold individually, but I liked the fact that this came with 5 ink cartridges. I purchased the umber color pen and it came with a blue ink cartridges inside and a small box of 5 black ink cartridges. If you are thinking about making the switch from ball point to fountain like I did, I fully recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Smooth writing, light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is my to go pen so far. It is very light weight. I feel very comfortable when i hold it. It writes very smoothly. I use it to take note. It makes writing so fun. Also it is very convenient to change the ink. Not like traditional pen. But it has the same functionality like pen. I used it for long time already and still very good. Good quality and definitely worth to try.
customer_reviews.author: Sisi Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth one star
customer_reviews.text: Worst pen. It doesn’t glide, feels cheaper than a dollar store pen, and makes a terrible nails on chalkboard noise when using it. Not sure how many of these good reviews were bought, but I am questioning the pens rating authenticity
customer_reviews.author: D g

customer_reviews.title: My Cap won't stay on now.
customer_reviews.text: Great pen. I use it every day all day. but now just a few weeks after my purchase the cap will not stay on. Needless to say this is very disappointing for a $20 pen. It used to just click on, now I have to force it on and sometimes it stays and sometimes it doesn't. This is concerning for a fountain pen for obvious ink dripping reasons. If this didn't happen 5 stars all the way. It writes like a dream. Goes through ink pretty fast but that is probably because i find myself doodling for the sake of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan and Katie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pen, but a useless writing tool.
customer_reviews.text: This pen feels very comfy in my hand, but the ink flow drys out too quickly on the nib. That alone makes this a pretty, but useless fountain pen. This is a basic fault that I wouldn't expect in a $29 pen!
customer_reviews.author: Curt P.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't write smooth, leaks ink on my finger that is near the nib but not on it
customer_reviews.text: I have to return this. I heard such good things about "Lamy" fountain pens but this is not what I have read or heard about. This is scratchy writing, missing some, the barrel is "shaped" where you hold it but it's not comfortable, it's hard plastic. The cap has to be off of it or it hits my hand near my thumb and annoys that area. It's just not a comfortable or smooth pen at all in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: recycle-it

customer_reviews.title: Great Lamy Fountain pen!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful pen maker and this pen is a great price for those just getting into fountain pens. I purchased this one as a gift for my 12-year-old daughter for Xmas and she LOVES it. She uses it for school to take notes and draw and sketch at home. At the time of purchase, I paid $22. for the set which is an excellent value considering the ink refill is hard to come by in the states and you have to get them online.
customer_reviews.author: Michelleb Avery

customer_reviews.title: Just love this pen
customer_reviews.text: New to fountain pens and have been buying everything I can. This pen has been the best value for what you get. It's a great rugged pen and writes just beautifully. I think the ink window is a great bonus. I find there is no nib creep either unlike the Pilot Metros around the same price point. The weight is just right too for an everyday pen. I like the black ink provided and should last a long time as my daily driver. I've been using this in my Leuchtturm1917 Bullet Journal and haven't had any issues with bleeding or ghosting. It's just the right amount of ink.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: German engineering at it's finest
customer_reviews.text: The Lamy Safari is hands down the most perfect every day fountain pen. It's smooth, it's solidly built, and due to the ABS plastic, it's super lightweight even when posted. I coupled this pen with a lokta paper journal from Kathmandu Valley Co. and even though there was slight bleed-thru, the pen performed exactly how I expected from such fine engineering! You won't regret getting this pen!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J

customer_reviews.title: Nice pen
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said: this handles like a much more expensive pen. I needed a multipurpose pen for both sketching and writing and this serves very well. The ink flow is smooth - no juttering or spitting. The plastic body is... well, it's not polished exotic wood, but it's smooth and comfortable in the hand. Nice pen.
customer_reviews.author: Vexx22

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use, no experience friendly
customer_reviews.text: If you’re on the fence about trying this because you have no experience with these pens, just buy it. I know nothing about these, but it’s so stupid easy to install the ink cartridges and start writing with this pen that a monkey can do it.
customer_reviews.author: Baltazar Valdez

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice pen but should be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be a buy it for life situation but the cap now barely grabs onto the pen when in place and detaches with a light touch and is pretty disappointing for a $20 pen. I’ve had a dr. Grip pen that’s lasted longer. It still writes nice like the day I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: CRF

customer_reviews.title: German efficiency at its best
customer_reviews.text: This pen caught me by surprise. It's a much better instrument than I had expected. The design is one used by German school kids. Not entirely a great recommendation, I found instead it's much better than its peers in terms of performance for the price. If you're looking for a starter fountain pen, there is no better choice. And it's my favorite still.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: SMOOTH OPERATOR
customer_reviews.text: This is the smoothest writing pen I own. While I still prefer a Safari or something...girthier...to use when doing alot of writing, this is my go to pen for my planner and quick notes because of the incredible smoothness at which it writes and, let's be honest, it's simple all black finish and knurled texture makes it a joy to both use and look at.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely obsessed with this fountain pen. It is light weight and the texture of the pen prevents slippage on your fingers. The ink that comes with it does not bleed, but it does take a bit longer than normal to dry (not enough to bother me.) I don't do any kind of calligraphy, but the nib has been perfect for me in journaling, schedule planning, and taking notes. The black cardboard box that it came in was a tad bent, but probably happened during shipping. Final: Would definitely buy again; great pen for a great price. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Avery Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Blue instead of black
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great pen for a right handed person. As a left handed person it’s non functional. My husband likes to write with it, although the fine tip is scratchy and requires thick paper. They also included blue ink vs. the black ink that I ordered... so that was a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent writing
customer_reviews.text: Not a good pen. If you want a pen to write with consistently invest into a better pen or higher quality. Simple bulk ball points write better than this thing. Not sure if it was just a bad order or defect but mine could hardly write one word without having to reattempt to writing the same letter multiple times. Even using common fountain pen tips didnt help. Including varying pressures on the point, hand positions etc.
customer_reviews.author: Colby

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Pen has had issues since I bought it, I am left handed thought maybe it was just me. I’ve tried cleaning it, having someone else use it but it will never write more then a single letter without it having issues. **UPDATE** After removing the ink pod and soak the entire handle, nib, etc in cup of hot water and two -three drops dawn dish soap for about 5 hours. My Lamy safari works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: An excellent fountain pen that is affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this fountain pen. Looks and feels great ( medium size hand) and writes like a champ. I have few fountain pens but this is my favorite writing instrument. It writes medium and glides on the paper. It came with blue ink but refill inks are black. Highly recommend this pen.
customer_reviews.author: Mountainwave

customer_reviews.title: Crazy over Lamy
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these pens now and I love these pens for my day to day writing. This pen is my work horse. The quality and the ability to change the nibs so easily are all great attributes of this pen. Depending on how thick you like you lines to be when writing I would recommend the extra fine nib. If you are just starting off with fountain pens this is an amazing pen for the price and if you are all ready a fountain pen enthusiast and looking to diversify your collection give these are try.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto SalasTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feel and consistent
customer_reviews.text: Solid fountain pen. Bought on Neil Gaiman recommendation as a starter listening to Tim Ferriss's podcast. Excellent writing feel. The line weight is a tad thicker than I'd like, but I enjoy very narrow pen lines. Extremely nice for writing and feels amazing in the hand. Highly recommend as a starter pen, excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: mike r

customer_reviews.title: Smoothness writing
customer_reviews.text: I just want to add this pen to the collection for entry fountain pen users. After a few lines, off it went to the box with the Parker jotter. It is well design, I appreciate the bolt design but right out of the box, this pen does not get to far.
customer_reviews.author: Not2pickee

customer_reviews.title: Writing wonder
customer_reviews.text: Honestly didn’t know what to think at first, after ten mins of use I was wouldn’t go back to anything else. Just buy the damn thing, it’s worth every penny. Beautiful construction, ease of use and unbeatable value for dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good product, I used it every day for a year.
customer_reviews.text: This pen writes great and I am very happy with how it flows. However, I got it to replace the red version, which was the same price, and so I expected this to be the same. However, this one is made of plastic, instead of the metal, which makes it look and feel slightly cheap. Even so, I am happy with the product, despite having to buy ink cartridges now and then. Pros: Good feel, nice to write with Cons: Made of plastic, need to replace the ink about once a week
customer_reviews.author: Portia Maidment

customer_reviews.title: Great pen, but, ink was dry after I used the ink that came with the pen
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this pen, even though it's $21! I thought that was ok if it worked well. The ink it came with was great, but, after that I tried two different inks that came with the package and they were both dry. The bummer is I missed the return window b/c the first ink lasted a month. Not happy about having to buy more ink when I have a dried up 5 pack.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it's a knockoff
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this is a knockoff. However it's a pretty good knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Raul.Sheep

customer_reviews.title: Great Pen
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful to purchase an article that has had careful thought put into it's design. I have been writing with fountain pens for years, but this is the first one that makes sense. The ink cartridge cannot come loose and spill ink all over your fingers and in your pocket. The angled grip is perfect so the pen cannot spin around in your fingers and the fine nib is just right for my needs. Oh and the price is a steal, I have paid a lot more for a lot worse.
customer_reviews.author: scoller

customer_reviews.title: Reliable fountain pen - writes beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Does the job! Comes with ink cartridge, ready to go. Makes writing more of a joy. Great brand that I used to only be able to find in Europe. If you’re not used to writing with a fountain pen, this is a great first one to use and get.
customer_reviews.author: SassyMe

customer_reviews.title: Fun pen to use. Writes pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I can think of for this fountain pen is that you have to write with it at an odd angle. Unfortunately it doesn't bode well with my current writing style.
customer_reviews.author: Butters

customer_reviews.title: Decent Pen
customer_reviews.text: I think next time i would have gone for a finer nib since I write into my calendar in small handwriting. Great for writing in larger size font.
customer_reviews.author: Danzel

customer_reviews.title: Orders came and are NOT COMPLETE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and PAID for a fountain pen with refills but the refills DIDN’T come. I’m so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Yeriel

customer_reviews.title: Who knew writing was so much fun?
customer_reviews.text: The Lamy Safari changed how I look at writing. I now actually look forward to when I have to write something down. After this angelic writing experience, I never want to go back to using a ballpoint pen. This and the Pilot Metropolitan are quality gateways to the fountain pen world. Worth every penny and more in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Linford

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend Lamy pens! This is a great, inexpensive fountain pen!
customer_reviews.text: Great starter fountain pen. Only negative is they the pen will dry out if you leave the cap off more than a few hours, but this is true with nearly all fountain pens
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good Pen For The Money
customer_reviews.text: For the money you pay, its a great starter fountain pen. Even for seasoned artist, this is a good option if you want an extra. The build is plastic, but the finish feels great and the grip shape on the barrel looks appealing and feels great too. It does take a little bit to break in so give it a little time. After its broken into it draws and writes great. Overall I'm satisfied with this pen.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Nargang

customer_reviews.title: Love My First Fountain Pen
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ever fountain pen and boy do I love it! I got the fine nib which, although broader than I was initially used to, I grew to love. Within a month of purchasing this pen, I decided to buy bith the LAMY Joy calligraphy set as well as the LAMY Lx. What can I say, LAMY makes great pens?
customer_reviews.author: RyceBall

customer_reviews.title: Very, very good pen
customer_reviews.text: I own several fountain pens... some of them high end. I would submit that this pen is so well designed; has such good build quality; and is priced so fairly, that anyone who enjoys using more classic writing instruments try this pen... you will no be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Draper

customer_reviews.title: Best value fountain pen out there
customer_reviews.text: There is something so intentional about writing with a fountain pen. And there is something so elegant about writing with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse pen
customer_reviews.text: I've used high-priced fountain pens that may write well, but the money you spend on them is really for what's on the outside. This is not one of those pens. I would call this pen a workhorse. It feels great in the hand (I really love the material it's made of), and writes great, too. While this will not impress any fountain pen snobs, it's fantastic for everyday writing.
customer_reviews.author: j25

customer_reviews.title: ink doesn't flow smoothly...
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically, this pen has a nice feel and I like the hard lines for handling. My disappointment is due to the ink flow... It's not nearly as smooth as I had hoped. It is one of the more affordable fountains offered, but definitely not the quality that I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: rainier6

customer_reviews.title: Switch to this pen! you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pen, I cannot go back to writing with ballpoints now. I've had this for a few weeks and have been religiously carrying it around and sharing the good news with everyone that asks about it. The one thing is that the replacement cartridges aren't super cost-effective, but I have read that you can get an adapter to fill it with ink, which I will try.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Best pen
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend is an architect and she loves pens. This is by far her FAVORITE pen ever. She uses it so much she already finished the first cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice writing lines, even and smooth writing. Good value because it comes with five extra ink cartridges, and has one bonus fatridhe installed in pen already. Looking forward to using as my daily writing instrument.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great pen for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great pen for the money. Smooth an always ready to write, this pen is worthwhle and a pleasure to use
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Lititz

customer_reviews.title: Ink flows poorly
customer_reviews.text: The ink doesn’t flow well. Very scratchy. I’m returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Lamy Safari fountain pens continue to be a reliable and favorite product in the planning community. Great product and value.
customer_reviews.author: L.K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Barely releases ink
customer_reviews.text: This pen doesn't even work like a fountain pen is supposed to. The ink doesn't flow out properly, and the nib scratches the paper. Not sure where all these positive reviews are coming from. I ordered the Black Forest pen at the same time, and it blew this pen out of the water. Did they send me a defective pen? Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: CatherineWL

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this pen.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this pen. The color, style, texture, weight, the amount of ink it puts down.. all of these come together to create an experience that is clearly above your average pen. I used it to draw everyday and it was satisfying to use from the moment I pulled it out of my bag. Sadly, mine was stolen... but that's just how good it looks I suppose. 5 stars. Would buy again if I wasn't on such a tight budget this semester.
customer_reviews.author: Deego

customer_reviews.title: Could Use Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I like the pen and enjoy writing with it but I would go with an extra fine over a fine next time. It writes a little too thick for my taste but that is just my preference. The cap does not fit as snugly as I would like and often when pulling it from my pocket I end up with just the cap. I also find that the ink cartridges do not last me as long as a traditional pen would.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Took me a little bit to get used to the grip..
customer_reviews.text: but now I like it very much. Its starting to become my favorite everyday pen too. Thinking about ordering a second one for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Pens works nice for a few months and out of nowhere it started leaking. Feels nice in hand as my first fountain pen
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great design, color and it's super lightweight! My new daily sketch tool!
customer_reviews.author: cookiemonster

customer_reviews.title: Suprised!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping time was good. This Lamy is the worst so far that I've purchased. Initially I felt I had received a knock off. The nib is very dry to the point where it doesn't write at times. I am using the Lamy ink cartridge that came with the pen when I use it. I do not use it often as it is unreliable. It may need some nib tuning.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Missing out
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this pen. Smooth writing, dark, and perfect barrel size. I have been missing out.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Affordable pen
customer_reviews.text: The sheer essence is good, it is great for beginners that are starting writing and it is very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Floro detergent

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Lame about this Lamy Fountain Pen!
customer_reviews.text: Received the pen and refills as a gift, and I very much like the smoothness of the writing and the color of the ink, very black for my uses. Having once again a fountain pen, I like the of the pen feel with its slanted places for the thumb and forefinger as well as the smooth flow to the nib. It take a little practice to apply the right pressure for smooth writing, but it didn't take too long.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hild

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This came with a fine tip, and not a medium tip as the photo shows.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Valerie Lautner

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, smooth, smooth!
customer_reviews.text: This pen is a joy to write with. Very light weight but the most comfortable grip. Great for people just getting in to using fountain pens.
customer_reviews.author: C Covington

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a gift for someone who is constantly taking notes. He loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Rey Kimberland

customer_reviews.title: nice writing
customer_reviews.text: took me a little while to get used to but i like that it is refillable.
customer_reviews.author: EBLBooks

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad pen
customer_reviews.text: This was intended as a gift. I assume it is a fake because it did not come in a it’s box. However this pen writes fantastically and does not leak. So the fact that it could not be wrapped because it did not come in the box it was supposed to may have been kinda nice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan LeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Great, stylish pen
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic pen. After using it for several months, I wish I had gotten a finer tip, so that's what I will invest in next. Overall, great for taking notes. Not so great for annotating in text because of the tip size. I would recommend this pen. Also, looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I got my Lamy and my dad's today and we're both so happy with them. I have to say I am thoroughly impressed and love how smooth and perfect it writes. I saw one review saying they didn't like the blue ink and I normally don't care for blue ink but mine writes perfectly and smoothly and is very impressive! The prestige of the Lamy Safari has surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a fountain pen, but be careful of lose barrel and leakage
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lamy ball pen for many years. This time I decide to pick up the Fountain pen. Great price, attractive yet timeless design. So far, I've received many compliments on the pen. It writes well, however, I do find the barrel tend to be more loose, even though it's a screw-on. Also, it can be a bit leaky, a couple of times, I find that there's ink left on my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: kat in a hat

customer_reviews.title: Today I am a Fountain pen!
customer_reviews.text: I like to give a Lamy fountain pen to persons who show interest in writing with a fountain pen. My doctor really loved this gift and has used it.
customer_reviews.author: candace j feinberg

customer_reviews.title: Smooth writing, satisfying feel
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase, the pen writes beautifully. I love how smooth it writes and how easy it is to change the ink. I will always have one of these pens in my office from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Best pen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pen for everyday use. People are constantly asking about it
customer_reviews.author: Dustoff664

customer_reviews.title: The old ways is the best ways!

customer_reviews.title: Great starter pen
customer_reviews.text: Really nice ink flow, easy to replace the cartridges, no mess, and for the price this seems like a great starter pen if you're wanting to test the waters with fountain pens. Would definitely recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Wants to bleed through any standard paper but I love this pen
customer_reviews.text: Get some high quality paper to write on. Wants to bleed through any standard paper but I love this pen. FYI though, I took it on a plane and the pressure difference caused the ink to bleed from the tip. My fault. Didn't think about that .
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This pen is amazing. I’ve never really liked fine pens in general but pair this with a 1.1 nib and it is incredible

customer_reviews.text: Great pen for practicing penmanship. Very good value. Pen has great balance and I don’t experience fatigue as quickly.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Really worthy. Not expensive but really useful. Easy to write, Not heavy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: chuchu_wawa

customer_reviews.title: Plastic, cheap and a scam
customer_reviews.text: This pen is lighter than paper and feels like paper, is poorly packaged and barely works. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Michele L.

customer_reviews.title: Genuine article, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Came in genuine packaging and the refill cartridges were included as advertised. Wrote perfectly well right out of the box. If you are very particular about which line weight you are looking for, you may have issues, but overall I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Lamy pens for awhile. It’s a great fountain pen for daily use, and for the price it’s a great pen. I spend less each year on ink than I did on purchasing pens before switching to Lamy. Another unexpected perk: no one steals my pens anymore lol

customer_reviews.title: This pen is beautiful and definitely a head turner
customer_reviews.text: This pen is beautiful and definitely a head turner. I have gotten many compliment and questions about this pen. This was also my introductory pen into the fountain pen world and I'm sure glad it was.

customer_reviews.title: Love this pen
customer_reviews.text: I been wanting to try fountain pens for awhile and found this one to be a great beginner pen would buy it against
